text:
Agencies, boards and commissions shall make adequate provision for public participation in the budget process. Such public participation must include, at a minimum, a public hearing on the proposed budget before submission to the Controller for consolidation. The Mayor shall provide for public input on the budget before his or her submission to the Board of Supervisors. The Board shall hold at least one public hearing on the budget before adoption; however, said hearing may be held by the Board Committee then having jurisdiction over the budget. 
(Added by Ord. 223-97, App. 6/6/97)
